intro: Anacheilium fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant anacheilium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its elegant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its flowers emit a subtle, sweet fragrance, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
